summary: In this context, decane and n-dodecane are mentioned as part of a selected set of compounds used to distinguish between allergic asthmatic children and control subjects through breath analysis. Both compounds are alkanes included in a pattern that aids in the non-invasive diagnosis of asthma, indicating their relevance in metabolic pathways associated with the condition. However, the specific relationship between decane and n-dodecane is not elaborated upon beyond their inclusion in the same diagnostic model.
